item.title: PyOhio 2011: Consuming Web APIs with Python
item.description:
Description

Consuming Web APIs with Python

Presented by Issac Kelly

Issac will go over the basics of HTTP apis, what to look for, basic authorization methods, and how to interface with them in your python scripts. There will not be cake.
item.dc:creator: Issac Kelly

item.title: PyOhio 2011: Creating Web APIs that are a joy to use
item.description:
Description

Creating Web APIs that are a joy to use

Presented by Issac Kelly

Issac is an avid API consumer. He&aposll cover how to make an API that is not terrible. This is apparently very difficult to do, and many anti-patterns will be shown. No care will be taken to protect the guilty. This talk is not as focused on Python, as it is on creating Web APIs, and an understanding of HTTP is assumed.
item.dc:creator: Issac Kelly

item.title: Python, Hardware, Networks and your toolbox for Interactive Art.
item.description:
Summary

Issac builds art and tells stories professionally with hardware and software. With an extraordinary project come extraordinary challenges. Having the right toolkit keeps you nimble enough to forge into the unknown with confidence. In this talk we'll explore a contrived art project with hardware, software, and networks, built with Python.
item.dc:creator: Issac Kelly

item.title: Building APIs in Django with Tastypie
item.description:
Description

Building APIs in Django with Tastypie

Issac Kelly

Tastypie is one of a couple of frameworks for building APIs with Django. Issac will go over some of the reasons you might pick Tastypie, and how to implement a Tastypie on top of an existing Django project.
item.dc:creator: Issac Kelly

item.title: Teaching Django to Comrades
item.description:
Description

Teaching Django to Comrades

Presented by Issac Kelly

Inevitably you're going to run into somebody who wants to learn Django, or maybe both Python and Django. This talk will help you make it less painful for them.
item.dc:creator: Issac Kelly

item.title: Reverse Engineering the Internet of Things
item.description:
Summary

This year I've reverse engineered two HTTP/Web enabled devices and written python clients for them. The Belkin Wemo [1] and the Philips Hue [2]. My poster session will cover methods materials and work.

[1] http://www.issackelly.com/blog/2012/08/04/wemo-api-hacking/ [2] http://www.issackelly.com/blog/2012/11/10/philips-hue-api-hacking/
item.dc:creator: Issac Kelly
